com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface getOrderLineStatusList

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface getOrderLineStatusList

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getOrderLineStatusList(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getOrderLineStatusList API returns a list of OrderStatus records and optionally, a list of DropStatus records, that satisfy a set of criteria.

    • Method Detail

      • getOrderLineStatusList

        org.w3c.dom.Document getOrderLineStatusList(YFSEnvironment env,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                            java.rmi.RemoteException
        The getOrderLineStatusList API returns a list of OrderStatus records and optionally, a list of DropStatus records, that satisfy a set of criteria. For example, criteria can be entered such as
        • a specific OrderHeaderKey
        • a specific OrderLineKey
        • a specific OrderReleaseKey
        • a TransactionID from the transaction tables.

        Criteria can be entered for multiple attributes, such as finding all OrderStatusLines for a specific OrderNo, which has a certain ReleaseNo.

        When calling the getOrderLineStatusList API, information to identify either an entire order or a specific order line can be passed in the input xml. If an order is specified, OrderStatus records are return for each of the order lines in the order. If an order line is specified, a OrderStatus record is return for that order line.

        To specify an Order, pass one of these:

          OrderHeaderKey
          EnterpriseCode and OrderNo
          OrderReleaseKey

        To specify an OrderLine, pass one of these:

          OrderLineKey
          OrderHeaderKey and PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Validations: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        A list of OrderStatus records and optionally, DropDtatus records, which satisfy the input criteria, are returned to the calling application. Passing TransactionId causes DropStatus records to be returned.

        Output Template Support:
        Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains a list of OrderStatus records and DropStatus records. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
